title: How to stretch a sample without changing pitch - Quora

response.answer_text: The easiest way would be to download a trial of Ableton Live for free. Drop an audio file in, click ‘Warp’ on the bottom left of the sampler. Select ‘Complex’ (located 3 sections under the ‘Warp option). Double-click anywhere on the waveform to create a ‘Warp Marker’, dragging this marker to the right will slow down you’re sample (by lengthening it), left to increase the speed (by shortening it). Or search on YT for ‘How to Warp a Sample in Ableton Live’.

Because digital audio is just numbers, it is possible to change the speed (stretch or squash) of an audio sample without changing pitch, or to change the pitch without affecting the speed. If you can get your sample onto a computer, you can use a program like Audacity (it's free) to do this kind of manipulation very easily.
